title: Diana - what am I missing?
body:
Once I get going with diana I am pretty bloody efficient. But I really struggle with her early game farm in mid (no so much in jg) and often find that if I get ganked then I am on the back foot with farm and no good until late game and have very little impact mid game. Late game monster is not good enough if we dont make it to late game.

What am I missing?

I was able to significantly increase my effectiveness with siv by adjusting build order and ability maximisation.

Any high level dianas able to give me a few pointers to make me more effective early and mid?

replies.body: Thanks for the tips. Last 2 games i have dominated by making tweaks  (rushing hourglass and maxing q) which has made a big difference.  Will also take your tips on board,  particularly not going too ham b pre 6.

I'm only in bronze so my thoughts could be of little value. 

I'd look at getting rid of your scaling ap blues, and maybe in place chuck in scaling cdr ones instead. It looks like you go for rylais second item, maybe look at picking up hourglass instead, for that bit of armour and the active.

I think another mid mistake I have been making is to max w first (which is what I do in jg).

Might max Q mid first instead for better poke potential?
Landing Q is almost a definite if you want that second toggle of ult. Maxing it first will lower CD and give a lot of damage.

> [{quoted}](name=Essembie,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=mHijIOaa,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2016-01-25T21:39:29.067+0000)
>
> I think another mid mistake I have been making is to max w first (which is what I do in jg).
> 
> Might max Q mid first instead for better poke potential?

Defintely Q needs to maxed first for wave clear and poke coupled with her passive 3rd strike and W if you have to, position yourself in such a way where her Q hits all melee and ranged minions. also like any assasin she can sacrifice a bit of farm for roaming ganks so long as they result in an assist at the very least.

Diana is my main, I find she is strong at all points of the game, her passive Q and W are huge damage dealers pre 6, once she is 6 her kill potential goes through the roof but is very reliant on landing her Q. She can be zoned easily but remember that her W gives two shields, once on cast and once again when all three balls explode which stacks with the original shield and refreshes duration, this can make her extremely difficult to kill early game, considering you can usually detonate all balls if you E and opponent on to you. Having your W up for an unexpected gank/fight is crucial to her survivability, you should only W for wave clear if you absolutely have to, you know where the enemy jungle is and your Lane opponent's gap closers are either down, or they are out of lane.

Her post 6 kill combo is like this (usually have to poke down to about 75% HP and have atleast a blasting wand, i usually build abyssal scepter vs AP mids first) auto attack minion twice to proc passive, throw out Q (if you dont land do not carry on with combo just start again) R on to them, Auto attack with passive proc, W to mitigate any initial damage, as your opponent runs use E and pop the rest of your balls, Ignite, then at this point you can either R on to them or wait for Q to come back up and Q R R. this whole process should take about 2.5 secconds so you need to practice and have fast fingers.

Add me in game if you want to practice diana together.
Thanks for that. AA 2 minions prior to engage is something I have not been doing. That is a fantastic insight thank you.

thanks for the tips man. TBH I hadnt done a set for diana and had just been piggybacking the ahri set. Will look at crafting a diana specific set today.

I had always avoided hourglass (just dont tend to grab it on champs because my experience has been that I jump in, trigger it, then die anyway because unless I am duoing the team fights in bronze are 50:50.
well if you get zhonya, you can jump in, kill someone, immunity for 2.5 sec, then kill someone again because your spells are likely close if not off cooldown by the time it ends.
I think I will put this in my build and try it out.

Hi, im not the highest ELO but I have a lot of games with Diana and a pretty decent record so I hope you find my comment helpful.
Try to avoid first picking Diana or picking her into champs like {{champion:63}} and {{champion:134}} who have extremely reliable ways to poke you without taking agro. Diana excels into squishy comps without hard CC and loves melee matchups the most.
 I usually take MPen reds, mana regen yellows, scaling AP blues and flat AP quints. With DRing start this gives you a lot of mana regen to farm with Q, and enough damage for it to hurt the enemy mid laner while the scaling blues add a lot to her late game but flat AP blues do give her better damage early if you think you can get a kill pre 6. If I know im going to take a lot of poke then I swap yellows and blues for flat resistances as combined with w she has a lot of staying power. 
Q or W first depending matchup then the other, E lvl 3 or 5 depending if you want to go for en early kill or if vs a Yas as u can interrupt his dash with it, max Q first, always take R when u can. 
Ideal combo is to Q them and stack passive then R just before the mark expires, E W aa Q R R.
If you can get the enemy to take agro a lot, Annie aa you within agro range etc, and poke effectively with q then you might be able to go for a lvl 3 or 4 surprise kill with flash ignite E W aa Q IF you have stacked your passive on minions. This is one of my fave ways to get ahead with Akali and Diana and works well if they have pushed the wave and you have just seen the enemy jungler elsewhere. So learning to manage the creep wave just outside your turret range will pay off big time.
You need to know when you can burst more effectively or when you have to duel. Her passive is where she gets a huge amount of damage so Nashors is almost always a good item for the CDR, AP, Att speed and its passive, but its not always good to rush and sometimes a lichbane is better like vs {{champion:7}}  as you often wont get to hit her very much before she dashes away and {{champion:105}} with her cheesy combo. Abyssal scepter is fantastic as most of your damage will be done within its passive range and if you have an AP top, jungle or support it will help lots in team fights, I almost always rush this item first unless im vs an AD mid. Rylais is a decent item for a bit of tank and the slow, usually better then ROA as building ROA early slows you power spike too much for mid, it works for top OK but only really if you need the sustain and your team doesn't need help early. Raba is a fantastic item for Diana as she scales so freaking well with AP, if snowballing and roaming this will usually be my 4th item. Abyss/Zon, Nashors/Lich, sorc boots, Raba/Void, Void/Raba. then any of GA/Banshees/Ludens/Rylais, before swapping sorc boots for mercs or CDR. Ludens is decent for the AP and move speed and the proc, can help dodge skill shots, catch enemies and clear waves if you need to split push which Diana can do very well with her passive, then use QR to escape over walls, also good to escape to wraiths when ganked. I find its often better to ward the dot bush to protect against ganks as a lot of junglers will aim to get behind you and this will protect you from most lapping ganks as well as side ganks if you watch your map and if you have a good sup who watches and pings like they should, beware Lee and Reksai wallhops. 
Looking at your record I see a lot of games vs AD without building a seekers or finishing zon which I would say is a big mistake and I dont think I saw Abyssal which I believe is core vs AP mids. Sorc boots early are stronger than CDR imo. Feel free to hit me up for a chat about items, build order and matchups if you want.
The moon will rise, the night will last forever!
